required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clitoris Potential Analgesic Function Research by Pregnant Women : Feasibility Study
clinical_study.official_title: Clitoris Potential Analgesic Function Research by Pregnant Women : Feasibility Study

brief_summary.textblock: Assessment of the acceptability by pregnant women on the research of the potential analgesic function of the clitoris.

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 15 months
primary_outcome.description: Among patients who had the information visit, proportion of those who were included and applied the procedure at least twice

arm_group.description: Use of a Vibrating Relaxation Tool in case of pain during pregn

intervention.description: Use of a Vibrating Relaxation Tool in case of pain during pregnancy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant woman, whatever the term, primiparous or multiparous
- Age â‰¥ 18 years old
- Patient having read and understood the information letter and signed the consent form
- Patient affiliated to Social Security
Exclusion Criteria:
- Inability to understand French or information,
- Person deprived of their liberty by an administrative or judicial decision
- Person placed under the protection of justice
- Person under guardianship or curatorship
